content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 42$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 42$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 12$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would consider this to be a repeated game with an element of reciprocity. In each round, there's a potential for mutual gain if we both choose R, but there's also a risk of losing out if I choose R and my opponent chooses B (or vice versa).

Given that the game is repeated 75 times, it seems rational to develop a strategy that encourages cooperation in the long run. One possible strategy is Tit-for-Tat: starting by choosing R, then matching my opponent's choice in each subsequent round. This way, if they choose R on the first round, I will also pick R, and we both get 45$. If they choose B on the first round, I will also pick B on the next round, hoping that they will reciprocate by choosing R on their next turn.

By following Tit-for-Tat, I aim to encourage my opponent to cooperate in the long run, which results in a higher overall payoff for both of us compared to always picking B or always picking R. Since this game is repeated multiple times, it becomes less risky to choose R on the first round because I have the opportunity to retaliate if my opponent chooses B and to be rewarded if they choose R as well.

With that reasoning in mind, my choice would be {R}.
You chose R. Your opponent chose R. Your payoff is 45$. Your opponent's payoff is 45$. Please play the next round.

Since my strategy was to use Tit-for-Tat, I will continue by choosing R in the next round as well. This way, I hope to encourage cooperation from my opponent and maximize our overall payoffs in the long run.
